alert.note: Alert for Baltimore (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 1:10PM EDT until July 25 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Baltimore County in northern Maryland... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 110 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sparrows Point... North Point State Park... Millers Island... Dundalk... Edgemere... Fort Howard... Turners Station... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
